required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 05, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of BOTOX® in Korean Adults With Chronic Migraine

oversight_info.authority: South Korea: Korea Food and Drug Administration (KFDA)

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of BOTOX® treatment in Korean adults with
      chronic migraine.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients with Adverse Events

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Headache Impact Test-6 (HIT-6) Total Score
Physician Global Assessment of Outcome on a 3-Point Scale

arm_group.description: Botulinum toxin Type A injected across specific head and neck muscles on Day 0.

intervention.description: Botulinum toxin Type A injected across specific head and neck muscles on Day 0.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Ethnically Korean with a diagnosis of chronic migraine

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Anticipated need for botulinum toxin treatment for any reason other than chronic
             migraine during the study

          -  Diagnosis of myasthenia gravis, Eaton-Lambert syndrome, or amyotrophic lateral
             sclerosis
